data.title: Thailand’s biggest seizure of call scam equipment
data.description: Police conducted multiple raids in the northern province of Chiang Mai and made the country’s biggest seizure of call scam equipment installed by a Thai-Chinese gang.

data.title: 50,000 tickets with 30% discount for New Year’s domestic flights
data.description: Six airlines offer 50,000 domestic flight tickets with a 30% discount to New Year travelers, according to the transport minister

data.title: Rama 2 roadworks delayed 5 months
data.description: The deadline for the Rama II elevated road construction work in Samut Sakhon has been postponed from June to November of next year, according to the Expressway Authority of Thailand (Exat).

data.title: Call to register trucks before ban
data.description: The Department of Land Transport (DLT) is calling on operators of six-wheeled trucks and over to register their vehicles before City Hall implements its Low Emission Zone air pollution control programme next year.

data.title: 3 rounds of referendum 'essential'
data.description: Three rounds of referendum are a must for a proposed rewrite of the 2017 constitution, Nikorn Chamnong, secretary to the joint House-Senate House panel on the referendum bill, said.

data.title: SSF boosts pension, severance
data.description: Social security subscribers will receive more pension and severance pay once the way this is calculated has been revised as planned, according to the Social Security Board.

data.title: Army says no tensions with UWSA on border
data.description: The army has dismissed media reports about tensions over a standoff between Thai military forces and United Wa State Army (UWSA) fighters in Mae Hong Son

data.title: Floods ravage four southern provinces
data.description: The four southern provinces of Songkhla, Pattani, Yala and Narathiwat are being hit by heavy rain and severe floods that have ravaged houses and forced schools and roads to close.

data.title: PP won't join Sondhi rally
data.description: The main opposition People

data.title: More effort pledged to protect Buddhism
data.description: The government has vowed to work more actively to protect  Buddhism  by watching out for problems, instead of waiting until they make headlines or people complain about them.

data.title: Buri Ram land dispute ‘affects hundreds’
data.description: More than 900 long-time local residents stand to be affected by a court ruling in the  Khao Kradong  land controversy in  Buri Ram , according to Deputy Interior Minister Songsak Thongsri.

data.title: Three flyovers to be axed for Orange Line
data.description: The Mass Rapid Transit Authority of Thailand (MRTA) has unveiled plans to dismantle three key  flyovers  in Bangkok to enable construction of the  Orange Line  electric railway, along with measures to minimise the impact on  traffic .

data.title: Kanchanaburi seeks reopening of border pass
data.description: Officials in  Kanchanaburi  province hope the Ban Phu Nam Ron  border pass  can be reopened by the New Year to boost cross-border trade, employment and investment between Thailand and Myanmar.

data.title: Lese-majeste prisoner wins early release
data.description: A Phitsanulok woman jailed for  lese-majeste  was released from prison on Wednesday, a month before her 18-month sentence was to end, after a court approved her request to withdraw her appeal, according to Thai Lawyers for Human Rights (TLHR).

data.title: Thai zoos to expand ‘Moo’ population
data.description: Plans are under way for the older brother of the celebrity hippo Moo Deng  to mate with Moo Manao of the Nakhon Ratchasima Zoo to expand the pygmy hippopotamus population in Thailand.

data.title: Thai, 5 Chinese arrested after sneaking across Myanmar border into Tak
data.description: A Thai man was arrested after helping five Chinese nationals  illegally enter Thailand from Myanmar  in the northern province of Tak on Tuesday evening.

data.title: Manhunt underway as 3 shot dead in northeastern Thailand
data.description: NONG BUA LAMPHU: A man, 57, shot dead three people in Sri Bun Ruang district of this northeastern province on Wednesday morning.

data.title: Manhunt underway as 3 people shot dead in northeastern Thailand
data.description: NONG BUA LAMPHU: A man, 57, shot dead three people in Sri Bun Ruang district of this northeastern province on Wednesday morning.

data.title: Manhunt underway as 3 people shot dead in northeastern Thailand
data.description: NONG BUA LAMPHU: A man, 57, shot dead three people in Sri Bun Ruang district of this northeastern province on Wednesday morning.

data.title: Man shot dead three people in Northeast
data.description: NONG BUA LAMPHU: A man, 57, shot dead three people in Sri Bun Ruang district of this northeastern province on Wednesday morning.

data.title: Bangkok to renew fees to encourage sorting of rubbish
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) is expected to renew garbage collection fees next June as part of its efforts to encourage people to sort their household waste.

data.title: Airports of Thailand to pay B12bn due to noise pollution from new runway
data.description: Airports of Thailand (AoT) plans to issue 12 billion baht in compensation to residents impacted by noise pollution from the third and newest runway at Suvarnabhumi Airport.

data.title: Swedish tourist loses B42,000 to Pattaya thief
data.description: PATTAYA: A Swedish tourist told police that a thief stole about 42,000 baht worth of valuables from him early Wednesday morning.

data.title: Adviser to Thai PM sees coup threat in protests
data.description: Any anti-government demonstrations will likely lead to the illegitimate seizure of power, Nattawut Saikuar, an adviser to the prime minister, has warned.

data.title: Prawit confidant refutes iCon fraud connection rumours
data.description: Gen Vitch Devahasdin na Ayudhya, a close associate of Gen Prawit Wongsuwon, tried to distance the Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP) leader from politician Samart Janechaijittawanich, who was  arrested on Monday  in connection with the high-profile public fraud case linked to The iCon Group.

data.title: Legal issues threaten Koh Samui maid's claim to late employer's estate
data.description: Nutwalai Pupongta, the trusted housemaid of a French businesswoman who committed suicide in Koh Samui on April 29, might not be able to inherit 100 million baht in assets from her former employer as police have found the deceased illegally ran businesses and owned luxury villas via nominees.

data.title: Rules issued for migrant workers
data.description: Two ministerial regulations are being issued to prevent labour trafficking and extend legal protection for dependents of migrant workers, according to the Interior Ministry.

data.title: Meet to focus on Chiang Mai flood recovery
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra will hold her first mobile cabinet meeting in Chiang Mai under the theme "From Flood To Flourish", to rehabilitate Chiang Mai following major floods.

data.title: Senate to hear testimonies on 'social media fraud'
data.description: Relevant agencies have been invited to testify at a Senate meeting next week on alleged fraud and money laundering involving Thonburi Healthcare Group founder Boon Vanasin, who is believed to be hiding out in China.
